2022-09-28.name: Grundy County Corn Festival
2022-09-28.summary: The festival in this town on the Illinois River between Ottawa and Joliet offers stagecoach and train rides, a crackerbox derby, a pie-eating contest, music, a carnival, Saturday fireworks and a parade at 2 p.m. Sunday.

2022-09-28.name: Iowa City Book Festival
2022-09-28.summary: The first North American town to be named a UNESCO City of Literature offers talks, readings, panels, exhibits and a walking tour of literary Iowa City.

2022-09-29.name: Grundy County Corn Festival
2022-09-29.summary: The festival in this town on the Illinois River between Ottawa and Joliet offers stagecoach and train rides, a crackerbox derby, a pie-eating contest, music, a carnival, Saturday fireworks and a parade at 2 p.m. Sunday.

2022-09-29.name: Oktoberfest
2022-09-29.summary: At this big riverfront festival, there's food, music and carnival rides, plus the opening Torchlight Parade and the Maple Leaf Parade on Saturday morning.

2022-09-29.name: Iowa City Book Festival
2022-09-29.summary: The first North American town to be named a UNESCO City of Literature offers talks, readings, panels, exhibits and a walking tour of literary Iowa City.

2022-09-30.name: Grundy County Corn Festival
2022-09-30.summary: The festival in this town on the Illinois River between Ottawa and Joliet offers stagecoach and train rides, a crackerbox derby, a pie-eating contest, music, a carnival, Saturday fireworks and a parade at 2 p.m. Sunday.

2022-09-30.name: World Music Festival
2022-09-30.summary: More than 80 artists perform at more than 30 venues

2022-09-30.name: Oktoberfest
2022-09-30.summary: At this big riverfront festival, there's food, music and carnival rides, plus the opening Torchlight Parade and the Maple Leaf Parade on Saturday morning.

2022-09-30.name: Oktoberfest
2022-09-30.summary: There's German music and food at this Amana Colonies village, plus contests that include the Eisenmann, or Iron Man, competition: Teams roll kegs, walk a balance beam with full steins of beer and saw logs. The parade is at 10 a.m. Saturday.

2022-09-30.name: Northeast Iowa Artists' Studio Tour
2022-09-30.summary: Drive through scenic bluff country to see 42 artists at             31 sites around Decorah, Burr Oak, St. Lucas, Waukon, West Union, Cresco, New Albin, Lansing, Elgin and Clermont.

2022-09-30.name: Door County Fall Lighthouse Festival
2022-09-30.summary: The Door County Maritime Museum sponsors tours by air, land and water to lighthouses on the peninsula, some of which can be visited only during festival weekends. Reserve as early as possible.

2022-09-30.name: World Music Festival
2022-09-30.summary: More than 80 artists perform at more than 30 venues.

2022-09-30.name: Iowa City Book Festival
2022-09-30.summary: The first North American town to be named a UNESCO City of Literature offers talks, readings, panels, exhibits and a walking tour of literary Iowa City.

2022-09-07.name: Defeat of Jesse James Days
2022-09-07.summary: In this college town south of the Twin Cities, there's a fine-arts festival, tractor pulls, a bike tour, reenactments of the famous bank raid and a Sunday parade.

2022-09-07.name: Sandwich Fair
2022-09-07.summary: This northeast Illinois fair, held since 1888, features exhibits, entertainment and music plus harness racing, tractor pulls and demolition derbies.

2022-09-09.name: Sandwich Fair
2022-09-09.summary: This northeast Illinois fair, held since 1888, features exhibits, entertainment and music plus harness racing, tractor pulls and demolition derbies.

2022-09-09.name: James J. Hill Days
2022-09-09.summary: This Minneapolis suburb features a street market and carnival, dachshund races, a craft-beer fest, logrolling and fireworks on Saturday and a parade on Sunday.

2022-09-09.name: Villa Louis Carriage Classic
2022-09-09.summary: The Victorian estate on the Mississippi River hosts horses, restored carriages and drivers in period dress for             competitive arena and cross-country sport driving, a passion of the frontier aristocrats who built it.

2022-09-09.name: Festival of the Vine
2022-09-09.summary: There's an arts and crafts show, flower market, music, wine tasting and sampling of food from local restaurants.

2022-09-09.name: Harvest Moon Festival
2022-09-09.summary: In Whiteside Park, there's an arts fair plus music, an old-time medicine show and pony rides and a petting zoo for kids.

2022-09-09.name: Paw Paw Wine & Harvest Festival
2022-09-09.summary: This big festival in southwest Michigan wine country features music on three stages, Friday fireworks, an art fair, motorcycle and bicycle tours, grape stomps and a Sunday parade.

2022-09-09.name: Radio Waves Music Festival
2022-09-09.summary: WTIP, North Shore Community Radio, hosts this outdoor fest of more than 25 local and regional music acts next to the municipal campground.

2022-09-10.name: Defeat of Jesse James Days
2022-09-10.summary: In this college town south of the Twin Cities, there's a fine-arts festival, tractor pulls, a bike tour, reenactments of the famous bank raid and a Sunday parade.

2022-09-10.name: Sandwich Fair
2022-09-10.summary: This northeast Illinois fair, held since 1888, features exhibits, entertainment and music plus harness racing, tractor pulls and demolition derbies.

2022-09-10.summary: This Minneapolis suburb features a street market and carnival, dachshund races, a craft-beer fest, logrolling and fireworks on Saturday and a parade on Sunday.

2022-09-10.summary: The Victorian estate on the Mississippi River hosts horses, restored carriages and drivers in period dress for             competitive arena and cross-country sport driving, a passion of the frontier aristocrats who built it.

2022-09-10.summary: There's an arts and crafts show, flower market, music, wine tasting and sampling of food from local restaurants.

2022-09-10.name: Harvest Moon Festival
2022-09-10.summary: In Whiteside Park, there's an arts fair plus music, an old-time medicine show and pony rides and a petting zoo for kids.

2022-09-10.name: Laura Ingalls Wilder Days
2022-09-10.summary: The famous author's birthplace celebrates this year with a scaled-down festival this year at the Laura Ingalls Wilder Museum, including traditional music and crafts, pie-eating and fiddling.

2022-09-10.name: Ethnic Fest
2022-09-10.summary: Alphornists, Scandinavian dancers and Anishinaabe drum and dance corps perform in this town on the shores of Leech Lake. There's also a parade.

2022-09-10.name: Taste of the Trail
2022-09-10.summary: In Lanesboro, Whalan and Peterson on the Root River State Trail, enjoy music, wagon rides and free samples from local restaurants and growers.

2022-09-10.name: Mural Fest
2022-09-10.summary: Go on guided tours of Ashland's famous murals, meet the artists and go on a mural scavenger hunt. There's also food, music, crafts and a car show.

2022-09-10.name: Little Falls Arts & Crafts Fair
2022-09-10.summary: This large fair, with nearly 600 artists, includes a car show and an antiques and collectibles section as well as a Man Cave.

2022-09-10.name: Festival of Arts and Gallery Tour
2022-09-10.summary: This juried art show, in Memorial Park on the shore of Lake Superior, includes a live art auction and a tour of studios and galleries, with artist demonstrations.

2022-09-10.name: Grand Rapids Riverfest
2022-09-10.summary: This music festival downtown features Wilco, Chastity Brown, Wild Horses and Shovels & Rope.

2022-09-10.name: Paw Paw Wine & Harvest Festival
2022-09-10.summary: This big festival in southwest Michigan wine country features music on three stages, Friday fireworks, an art fair, motorcycle and bicycle tours, grape stomps and a Sunday parade.

2022-09-10.name: Rock Bend Folk Festival
2022-09-10.summary: This free, easygoing festival is in this Minnesota River town's Minnesota Square Park.

2022-09-10.name: Sputnikfest
2022-09-10.summary: Help celebrate the 1962 crash landing of a 20-pound piece of Russia's Sputnik on a street in Manitowoc. There's a wacky costume contest, a Miss Space Debris pageant, a pet costume contest, a space-themed movie and music.

2022-09-10.name: Whooping Crane Festival
2022-09-10.summary: Celebrate the whooping-crane migration with voyageur canoe trips, a marketplace, crane trivia, children's activities and bird walks.

2022-09-10.name: Monarch Festival
2022-09-10.summary: This festival at Lake Nokomis celebrates the monarch migration from Minnesota to Mexico and includes a costume parade, music, dance, art activities and monarch games.

2022-09-10.name: Washington County Bluegrass Festival
2022-09-10.summary: Bluegrass bands will play at this family festival at Lake Elmo Park Reserve at the eastern edge of the Twin Cities, free with $7 vehicle permit. There also will be camping and food vendors.

2022-09-10.name: Radio Waves Music Festival
2022-09-10.summary: WTIP, North Shore Community Radio, hosts this outdoor fest of more than 25 local and regional music acts next to the municipal campground.

2022-09-10.name: Greenway Glow
2022-09-10.summary: Along the Midtown Greenway bike route in south Minneapolis, enjoy live music, art installations and theatrical performances.

2022-09-11.summary: This large fair, with nearly 600 artists, includes a car show and an antiques and collectibles section as well as a Man Cave.

2022-09-11.name: Festival of Arts and Gallery Tour
2022-09-11.summary: This juried art show, in Memorial Park on the shore of Lake Superior, includes a live art auction and a tour of studios and galleries, with artist demonstrations.

2022-09-11.name: St. Paul Classic Bike Tour
2022-09-11.summary: Ride a 1-, 29- or 32-mile route along the Mississippi, lakes Como and Phalen and St. Paul parkways, starting and ending at Como Park Pavilion and punctuated by food and live music.

2022-09-11.name: Scandinavian Day
2022-09-11.summary: This festival in Vasa Park, along the Fox River, features music, dancing, food and crafts from the Nordic countries.

2022-09-11.name: Paw Paw Wine & Harvest Festival
2022-09-11.summary: This big festival in southwest Michigan wine country features music on three stages, Friday fireworks, an art fair, motorcycle and bicycle tours, grape stomps and a Sunday parade.

2022-09-11.name: Rock Bend Folk Festival
2022-09-11.summary: This free, easygoing festival is in this Minnesota River town's Minnesota Square Park.

2022-09-11.name: Radio Waves Music Festival
2022-09-11.summary: WTIP, North Shore Community Radio, hosts this outdoor fest of more than 25 local and regional music acts next to the municipal campground.

2022-09-22.name: Boats and Bluegrass
2022-09-22.summary: This family-oriented festival in Prairie Island Park, on the Mississippi River, features disc golf and paddling as well as music. A weekend pass includes camping and canoeing, and kids under 16 are free with an adult ticket. Buy tickets early to save money.

2022-09-22.name: Oktoberfest
2022-09-22.summary: There will be music, wagon rides, chainsaw carving, children's activities and, of course, beer from New Glarus Brewing.

2022-09-22.name: Oktoberfest of Greater Racine
2022-09-22.summary: Lakefront Brewery hosts this free, family-friendly festival at Franksville Craft Beer Garden, featuring stein-hoisting and nail-driving contests, yard games, a pig roast, live music, bounce houses for the kids and two dozen craft beers on tap.

2022-09-23.name: Boats and Bluegrass
2022-09-23.summary: This family-oriented festival in Prairie Island Park, on the Mississippi River, features disc golf and paddling as well as music. A weekend pass includes camping and canoeing, and kids under 16 are free with an adult ticket. Buy tickets early to save money.

2022-09-23.name: Oktoberfest
2022-09-23.summary: There will be music, wagon rides, chainsaw carving, children's activities and, of course, beer from New Glarus Brewing.

2022-09-23.name: Apple Festival
2022-09-23.summary: There'll be arts and crafts and music in this southwest Wisconsin village. The big parade is Sunday.

2022-09-23.name: Fall Fest
2022-09-23.summary: In the colorful northwest Wisconsin woods, there'll be hay rides, corn maze, a chili cook-off, fish boil, arts and crafts and fireworks.

2022-09-23.name: Cranberry Festival
2022-09-23.summary: At this huge festival in west-central Wisconsin, there'll be marsh tours, pie-eating contests and more than 1,000 booths selling antiques, produce and arts and crafts.

2022-09-23.name: Oktoberfest
2022-09-23.summary: Take polka-dancing lessons, enter the Bier Maiden or stein-holding contests and win costume prizes at this outdoor fest under tents  downtown.

2022-09-23.name: Harvest Fair
2022-09-23.summary: This free festival at the Wisconsin State Fairgrounds features lumberjack shows, pumpkin bowling, scarecrow-making, kids' rides and entertainment on three stages.

2022-09-23.name: Soul & Blues Festival
2022-09-23.summary: This downtown music festival also features a culinary delights and beverage garden.

2022-09-23.name: Unplugged music festival
2022-09-23.summary: The harbor-side North House Folk School celebrates with storytelling, traditional workshops, an artisan marketplace and  concerts by songwriter/musicians.

2022-09-23.name: Bacon Bash
2022-09-23.summary: There will be pig races, a pig-calling contest, pig crafts, an amateur bacon cook-off and many bacon dishes, including ice cream.

2022-09-23.name: German Fest
2022-09-23.summary: There will be music, dancing, children's             games and lock and dam tours in this antebellum town on the Mississippi River.

2022-09-23.name: Kalona Fall Festival
2022-09-23.summary: This Mennonite community just southwest of Iowa City, famous for its quilts, offers pony rides, a pumpkin-carving contest, demonstrations of Old World artisanry, music and homemade potato chips, apple fritters, ice cream and chicken, biscuits and gravy.

2022-09-23.name: Octoberfest
2022-09-23.summary: This large downtown festival is more general civic celebration than German  festival, with an arts and crafts show, car show and music on five  stages.

2022-09-23.name: Oktoberfest of Greater Racine
2022-09-23.summary: Lakefront Brewery hosts this free, family-friendly festival at Franksville Craft Beer Garden, featuring stein-hoisting and nail-driving contests, yard games, a pig roast, live music, bounce houses for the kids and two dozen craft beers on tap.

2022-09-23.name: Cornish Festival
2022-09-23.summary: In the old lead-mining district in southwest Wisconsin, play shove ha'penny in the Kiddleywink Pub, eat figgyhobbin and pasties, listen to tommyknocker tales and tour Cornish miners' cottages.

2022-09-24.summary: This family-oriented festival in Prairie Island Park, on the Mississippi River, features disc golf and paddling as well as music. A weekend pass includes camping and canoeing, and kids under 16 are free with an adult ticket. Buy tickets early to save money.

2022-09-24.name: Cranberry Festival
2022-09-24.summary: At this huge festival in west-central Wisconsin, there'll be marsh tours, pie-eating contests and more than 1,000 booths selling antiques, produce and arts and crafts.

2022-09-24.name: Oktoberfest
2022-09-24.summary: Take polka-dancing lessons, enter the Bier Maiden or stein-holding contests and win costume prizes at this outdoor fest under tents  downtown.

2022-09-24.name: Harvest Fair
2022-09-24.summary: This free festival at the Wisconsin State Fairgrounds features lumberjack shows, pumpkin bowling, scarecrow-making, kids' rides and entertainment on three stages.

2022-09-24.name: Fall Festival
2022-09-24.summary: There's an arts and crafts fair, children's games, contests and live music downtown.

2022-09-24.name: Taste of the Trail
2022-09-24.summary: On the Root River State Trail, sample local food, listen to music, tour a museum and visit the International Owl Center.

2022-09-24.name: Johnny Appleseed Festival
2022-09-24.summary: In this northwest suburb of Chicago, there's pumpkin bowling, a pumpkin train and petting zoo, apple contests, music and a craft fair.

2022-09-24.name: Doors Open Milwaukee
2022-09-24.summary: More than 150 historic buildings — theaters, breweries, mansions, cathedrals, hotels, museums — are open to the public, and many offer free guided tours.

2022-09-24.name: Civil War Weekend
2022-09-24.summary: Battles are reenacted at this festival at the Wade House historic site near Sheboygan. There's also a traveling medicine show, court martials, a sutler's row, period concerts and appearances by Abraham Lincoln.

2022-09-24.name: World War II Days
2022-09-24.summary: Midway Village Museum hosts one of the largest World War II battle re-enactments in the nation, with more than 1,200 uniformed re-enactors and more than 60 vintage tanks and other armored vehicles.

2022-09-24.name: Soul & Blues Festival
2022-09-24.summary: This downtown music festival also features a culinary delights and beverage garden.

2022-09-24.summary: There will be pig races, a pig-calling contest, pig crafts, an amateur bacon cook-off and many bacon dishes, including ice cream.

2022-09-24.summary: Smithsonian magazine and participating museums in every state offer free admission for two people. Tickets are available for download on the website.

2022-09-24.name: German Fest
2022-09-24.summary: There will be music, dancing, children's             games and lock and dam tours in this antebellum town on the Mississippi River.

2022-09-24.name: Spirit of the St. Croix Art Festival
2022-09-24.summary: There will be music, food and a juried art show along the St. Croix River, in Lakefront Park.

2022-09-24.name: Hyde Park Jazz Festival
2022-09-24.summary: Listen to non-stop music during this free festival at venues in and around Midway Plaisance, near the Museum of Science and Industry and Lake Michigan.

2022-09-24.summary: This festival at Western Gateway Park features Latino music, dancing, arts, cultural booths, children's activities and a corn-eating contest.

2022-09-24.name: Beef-A-Rama
2022-09-24.summary: In this northern Wisconsin lake-resort town, there's a Rump Roast Run, beef-eating contest and Parade of Beef.

2022-09-24.name: All-State Barn Tour in Iowa
2022-09-24.summary: It's the Iowa Barn Foundation's annual             free, self-guided tour of restored historic barns.

2022-09-25.name: Milwaukee Riverkeeper Boat Parade

2022-09-25.summary: It's the Iowa Barn Foundation's annual             free, self-guided tour of restored historic barns.

2022-09-01.name: Minnesota State Fair
2022-09-01.summary: Try flights at the Craft Beer Hall, eat food on a stick, listen to free concerts and watch the 2 p.m. daily parade.

2022-09-01.name: Chicago Jazz Festival
2022-09-01.summary: This free festival features music at the Chicago Cultural Center and   Millennium Park.

2022-09-01.summary: This gathering of steam engines and antique cars, trucks and tractors also features a horse pull, concerts, square dancing and a parade.

2022-09-02.summary: Enjoy a weekend of music in             Mattson Lower Harbor Park on Lake Superior.

2022-09-02.summary: This Swiss town near Madison has been putting on an outdoor William Tell pageant since 1938. Festivities include a children's lantern parade, yodeling, an arts show and ethnic fashions.

2022-09-02.summary: In addition to heavy athletics — throwing weights, hammers, logs and sacks of hay — there will be piping, drumming, dancing, longbow competitions, dog demonstrations and traditional Scottish food.

2022-09-03.name: Marquette Area Blues Fest
2022-09-03.summary: Enjoy a weekend of music in             Mattson Lower Harbor Park on Lake Superior.

2022-09-03.name: Western Minnesota Steam Threshers Reunion
2022-09-03.summary: Revel in the past during this show of antique machinery, which includes rides on trains and a carousel, square dancing, roving musicians and nightly jamborees.

2022-09-03.name: Wilhelm Tell Festival
2022-09-03.summary: This Swiss town near Madison has been putting on an outdoor William Tell pageant since 1938. Festivities include a children's lantern parade, yodeling, an arts show and ethnic fashions.

2022-09-03.name: Wisconsin Highland Games
2022-09-03.summary: In addition to heavy athletics — throwing weights, hammers, logs and sacks of hay — there will be piping, drumming, dancing, longbow competitions, dog demonstrations and traditional Scottish food.

2022-09-03.name: Taste of Madison
2022-09-03.summary: This free benefit festival on Capitol Square includes 200 menu items from more than 80 restaurants, all priced at $1-$4. There's also music on three stages.

2022-09-03.name: Frankfort Fall Festival
2022-09-03.summary: The festival in this southern suburb of Chicago features more than 300 artisans, music, a carnival and a parade Sunday.

2022-09-03.name: Kites Over Lake Michigan
2022-09-03.summary: On Neshotah Beach, watch giant kites, precision stunt teams, a release of sky lanterns and fireworks. There will be live music Saturday night and free kite-making for kids on Saturday.

2022-09-03.name: Fox Jazz Festival
2022-09-03.summary: This free Fox Cities jazz festival is in Jefferson Park, on the shores of Lake Winnebago.

2022-09-03.name: Wisconsin State Cow Chip Throw
2022-09-03.summary: There's chip-chucking contests in this Wisconsin River town, but also music, kids' games and an arts and crafts fair.

2022-09-03.name: Marina Fest
2022-09-03.summary: In this Door County village, there will be a vintage boat show, craft fair,  kids' carnival, music and Saturday fireworks.

2022-09-04.name: Minnesota State Fair
2022-09-04.summary: Try flights at the Craft Beer Hall, eat food on a stick, listen to free concerts and watch the 2 p.m. daily parade.

2022-09-04.name: Chicago Jazz Festival
2022-09-04.summary: This free festival features music at the Chicago Cultural Center and   Millennium Park.

2022-09-04.name: Midwest Old Threshers Reunion
2022-09-04.summary: This gathering of steam engines and antique cars, trucks and tractors also features a horse pull, concerts, square dancing and a parade.

2022-09-04.name: Marquette Area Blues Fest
2022-09-04.summary: Enjoy a weekend of music in             Mattson Lower Harbor Park on Lake Superior.

2022-09-04.summary: Revel in the past during this show of antique machinery, which includes rides on trains and a carousel, square dancing, roving musicians and nightly jamborees.

2022-09-04.name: Fox Jazz Festival
2022-09-04.summary: This free Fox Cities jazz festival is in Jefferson Park, on the shores of Lake Winnebago.

2022-09-04.name: Marina Fest
2022-09-04.summary: In this Door County village, there will be a vintage boat show, craft fair,  kids' carnival, music and Saturday fireworks.

2022-09-04.name: Bike the Drive
2022-09-04.summary: Along a 30-mile loop, ride car-free on Lake Shore Drive, with a post-ride festival in Grant Park.

2022-09-04.name: Fox Valley Folk Music & Storytelling Festival
2022-09-04.summary: Musicians and storytellers perform on eight stages at this festival in Island Park on the Fox River.

2022-09-05.name: Minnesota State Fair
2022-09-05.summary: Try flights at the Craft Beer Hall, eat food on a stick, listen to free concerts and watch the 2 p.m. daily parade.

2022-09-05.name: Midwest Old Threshers Reunion
2022-09-05.summary: This gathering of steam engines and antique cars, trucks and tractors also features a horse pull, concerts, square dancing and a parade.

2022-09-05.name: Western Minnesota Steam Threshers Reunion
2022-09-05.summary: Revel in the past during this show of antique machinery, which includes rides on trains and a carousel, square dancing, roving musicians and nightly jamborees.

2022-09-05.name: Frankfort Fall Festival
2022-09-05.summary: The festival in this southern suburb of Chicago features more than 300 artisans, music, a carnival and a parade Sunday.

2022-09-05.name: Mackinac Bridge Walk
2022-09-05.summary: Once             a year, on Labor Day, people can walk across the five-mile span, the third-longest suspension bridge in the world.

2022-09-05.name: Marina Fest
2022-09-05.summary: In this Door County village, there will be a vintage boat show, craft fair,  kids' carnival, music and Saturday fireworks.

2022-09-05.name: Fox Valley Folk Music & Storytelling Festival
2022-09-05.summary: Musicians and storytellers perform on eight stages at this festival in Island Park on the Fox River.

2022-09-14.name: Pumpkin Festival
2022-09-14.summary: This town near Peoria, home of the Libby's pumpkin-packing plant, calls itself the Pumpkin Capital of the World. The festival features pumpkin-boat races, pumpkin decorating, pie-eating contests, a craft fair, a pumpkin-pancake breakfast and a 10:30 a.m. Saturday parade.

2022-09-15.name: Pumpkin Festival
2022-09-15.summary: This town near Peoria, home of the Libby's pumpkin-packing plant, calls itself the Pumpkin Capital of the World. The festival features pumpkin-boat races, pumpkin decorating, pie-eating contests, a craft fair, a pumpkin-pancake breakfast and a 10:30 a.m. Saturday parade.

2022-09-15.name: Michigan Irish Music Festival
2022-09-15.summary: There's music on three stages, plus dance and session tents, a cultural village, Celtic Kitchen and limerick contest.

2022-09-16.name: Pumpkin Festival
2022-09-16.summary: This town near Peoria, home of the Libby's pumpkin-packing plant, calls itself the Pumpkin Capital of the World. The festival features pumpkin-boat races, pumpkin decorating, pie-eating contests, a craft fair, a pumpkin-pancake breakfast and a 10:30 a.m. Saturday parade.

2022-09-16.name: Wo-Zha-Wa Days
2022-09-16.summary: There's a juried arts and             crafts show, a flea maraket, a street carnival and a parade Sunday.

2022-09-16.name: World Food & Music Festival
2022-09-16.summary: In downtown's East Village, eat at more than 50 cultural cafes for $5 or less (or taste for $1), shop at the world marketplace or listen to musicians strolling the streets or on stage.

2022-09-16.name: Cheese Days
2022-09-16.summary: This biennial festival in Wisconsin's cheese-making region features a cow-milking contest, a carnival, a Kids Street and Family Farm Adventure Tent and a big parade at 12:30 p.m. on Sunday.

2022-09-16.name: Grape Stomp
2022-09-16.summary: Carlos Creek Winery hosts this festival, which features music on two stages, an art fair, grape stomps and "I Love Lucy'' look-alike contests.

2022-09-16.name: Riot Fest
2022-09-16.summary: This Douglas Park music festival also features a circus sideshow revue and carnival.

2022-09-16.name: Wauktoberfest
2022-09-16.summary: This town just north of Madison celebrates with a craft-beer tasting, bike tour, music and lots of contests: frau carrying, yodeling, beer keg race, dachshund dash and Limburger cheese and sauerkraut eating.

2022-09-16.name: Gemuetlichkeit Days
2022-09-16.summary: This festival between Madison and Milwaukee is named for the German word for a cozy and congenial atmosphere. It includes sauerkraut-eating, nail-driving, facial hair and costume contests, a vintage car show, music and a parade at noon Sunday.

2022-09-16.name: Hot Air Balloon Days
2022-09-16.summary: In this town southwest of Des Moines, there are balloon races and night glows, a parade with marching-band contest, an arts and crafts fair and a flea market.

2022-09-16.name: Mahkato Wacipi
2022-09-16.summary: This traditional powwow in Land of Memories Park commemorates the 38 Dakota who were hanged after the 1862 U.S.-Dakota war.

2022-09-16.name: Oktoberfest
2022-09-16.summary: Expect entertainment on four stages, kids' activities, keg-rolling, sauerkraut-eating and stein-holding contests and a parade at 3 p.m. Saturday.

2022-09-16.name: Midwest Music Fest
2022-09-16.summary: Dozens of musical groups in all genres play in museums, galleries, cafes and arts centers across town. There are arts workshops for children, too.

2022-09-16.name: Mississippi Valley Blues Festival
2022-09-16.summary: In LeClaire Park on the river, blues musicians celebrate the music that traveled up the Mississippi.

2022-09-16.name: Michigan Irish Music Festival
2022-09-16.summary: There's music on three stages, plus dance and session tents, a cultural village, Celtic Kitchen and limerick contest.

2022-09-16.name: Oktoberfestival
2022-09-16.summary: This festival on the bayfront features stein-holding, barrel-rolling and pretzel-tossing contests, a kids' zone and a dachshund derby on Sunday, plus German food and music. Admission is $20, $10 up to week of event, free for youths 15 and under.

2022-09-16.name: Red Cliff Cultural Days
2022-09-16.summary: At this Ojibwe community just north of Bayfield, there will be a mini-powwow, sailboat rides, canoe races, traditional games, music, fireworks and sky lanterns.

2022-09-16.name: Audubon Days
2022-09-16.summary: The festival in this town next to big Horicon Marsh features bed races, a car show, craft fair, bag tournament and music.

2022-09-17.name: Pumpkin Festival
2022-09-17.summary: This town near Peoria, home of the Libby's pumpkin-packing plant, calls itself the Pumpkin Capital of the World. The festival features pumpkin-boat races, pumpkin decorating, pie-eating contests, a craft fair, a pumpkin-pancake breakfast and a 10:30 a.m. Saturday parade.

2022-09-17.name: Wo-Zha-Wa Days
2022-09-17.summary: There's a juried arts and             crafts show, a flea maraket, a street carnival and a parade Sunday.

2022-09-17.name: World Food & Music Festival
2022-09-17.summary: In downtown's East Village, eat at more than 50 cultural cafes for $5 or less (or taste for $1), shop at the world marketplace or listen to musicians strolling the streets or on stage.

2022-09-17.name: Cheese Days

2022-09-17.name: Grape Stomp
2022-09-17.summary: Carlos Creek Winery hosts this festival, which features music on two stages, an art fair, grape stomps and "I Love Lucy'' look-alike contests.

2022-09-17.name: Riot Fest
2022-09-17.summary: This Douglas Park music festival also features a circus sideshow revue and carnival.

2022-09-17.summary: This town just north of Madison celebrates with a craft-beer tasting, bike tour, music and lots of contests: frau carrying, yodeling, beer keg race, dachshund dash and Limburger cheese and sauerkraut eating.

2022-09-17.name: Gemuetlichkeit Days
2022-09-17.summary: This festival between Madison and Milwaukee is named for the German word for a cozy and congenial atmosphere. It includes sauerkraut-eating, nail-driving, facial hair and costume contests, a vintage car show, music and a parade at noon Sunday.

2022-09-17.name: Hot Air Balloon Days
2022-09-17.summary: In this town southwest of Des Moines, there are balloon races and night glows, a parade with marching-band contest, an arts and crafts fair and a flea market.

2022-09-17.name: Mahkato Wacipi
2022-09-17.summary: This traditional powwow in Land of Memories Park commemorates the 38 Dakota who were hanged after the 1862 U.S.-Dakota war.

2022-09-17.name: Wine & Harvest Festival
2022-09-17.summary: There's a pumpkin regatta — yes, people paddling hollowed-out pumpkins across Cedar Creek — at the fest in this historic mill town just north of Milwaukee. There's also a scarecrow contest, grape stomp, hay rides, juried arts fair and lots of food.

2022-09-17.name: Vintage Illinois at the Canal Market
2022-09-17.summary: Sample wine from more than 25 wineries and listen to music at this festival near Starved Rock State Park.

2022-09-17.name: Apple Days
2022-09-17.summary: On the shore of Lake Minnetonka, there's a history tour, apple pie-eating contest, music and a street dance.

2022-09-17.name: Oktoberfest
2022-09-17.summary: Expect entertainment on four stages, kids' activities, keg-rolling, sauerkraut-eating and stein-holding contests and a parade at 3 p.m. Saturday.

2022-09-17.name: Midwest Music Fest
2022-09-17.summary: Dozens of musical groups in all genres play in museums, galleries, cafes and arts centers across town. There are arts workshops for children, too.

2022-09-17.name: Taste of the Trail
2022-09-17.summary: On the Harmony-Preston Valley State Trail, sample local treats, listen to music, visit the National Trout Center, take wagon rides and play games.

2022-09-17.name: Scarecrow Fest
2022-09-17.summary: See early fall color around this town in Nicolet National Forest. There's pumpkin-chucking, pumpkin and scarecrow contests, a craft fair, car show, hay rides and free chili and deep-fried pickles.

2022-09-17.name: Party on the Pavement
2022-09-17.summary: Racine's biggest street festival features stages of entertainment and a car show, art walk, carnival rides and zones for kids and sports.

2022-09-17.name: Harvest Fest & Street Art Auction
2022-09-17.summary: This street party includes a car show, cornhole and chalk-art contests, music and artisans and winds up with the auction of 25 artist-created cherries.

2022-09-17.name: Bay View Bash
2022-09-17.summary: This street festival in the Bay View neighborhood includes music on four stages, a children's area, cooking demonstrations and a strong man competition.

2022-09-17.name: Mississippi Valley Blues Festival
2022-09-17.summary: In LeClaire Park on the river, blues musicians celebrate the music that traveled up the Mississippi.

2022-09-17.name: Michigan Irish Music Festival
2022-09-17.summary: There's music on three stages, plus dance and session tents, a cultural village, Celtic Kitchen and limerick contest.

2022-09-17.name: Oktoberfestival
2022-09-17.summary: This festival on the bayfront features stein-holding, barrel-rolling and pretzel-tossing contests, a kids' zone and a dachshund derby on Sunday, plus German food and music. Admission is $20, $10 up to week of event, free for youths 15 and under.

2022-09-17.name: Parade of Nations and Multicultural Festival
2022-09-17.summary: The parade begins in Hancock and ends in Houghton at Dee Stadium, where there's a festival with music, dancing and food from around the world.

2022-09-17.name: Squidfest
2022-09-17.summary: The festival in this Minnesota River Valley town features a pop-up sculpture garden on Main Street, art installations, a disc golf tournament, street performance, kids' activities, and live music all day. There's also a Ribfest.

2022-09-17.name: Red Cliff Cultural Days
2022-09-17.summary: At this Ojibwe community just north of Bayfield, there will be a mini-powwow, sailboat rides, canoe races, traditional games, music, fireworks and sky lanterns.

2022-09-17.name: Willy Street Fair
2022-09-17.summary: This street fair on Williamson Street on the isthmus features food, vendors, music on three stages and a parade at 11 a.m. Sunday.

2022-09-17.name: Audubon Days
2022-09-17.summary: The festival in this town next to big Horicon Marsh features bed races, a car show, craft fair, bag tournament and music.

2022-09-18.summary: There's a juried arts and             crafts show, a flea maraket, a street carnival and a parade Sunday.
